document.docTitle: Anthaxia (Cratomerus) tankenethi Obořil & Baňař 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A contribution to the taxonomy of Anthaxia (Cratomerus) (Coleoptera Buprestidae: Anthaxiini) of East Africa

FIGURES 4–8 . 4–6 Dorsal habitus of
Anthaxia ( Cratomerus ) tankenethi
sp. nov.
4, male holotype; 5, female paratype (Kenya, Mwingi); 6, female paratype of aberrant bluish colour (Tanzania, Same). 7–8 Dorsal habitus of
A. ( C. ) gebhardti Obenberger, 1924
. 7, male; 8, female (both Tanzania, Dodoma).

FIGURES 9–12 . 9–10 Ventral habitus of
Anthaxia ( Cratomerus ) tankenethi
sp. nov.
9, male paratype (Kenya, Voi); 10, female paratype (Ethiopia, Sidamo). 11–12 Ventral habitus of
A. ( C. ) gebhardti Obenberger, 1924
. 11, male; 12, female (both Tanzania, Dodoma).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description of holotype .
Body long and slender, cylindrical. Total body length 4.4 mm , widest across abdominal tergites, ratio of the total body length to maximum width (measured across abdomen) 3.28.

Antennae ( Figs 4–6 , 19 ) black, very short, not reaching middle of the pronotum when laid alongside, from antennomere IV segments conspicuously transverse, widest in antennomere VIII. Antennae sparsely covered with whitish setae. Scape elongate, pear-shaped, 2.8 times longer than wide. Pedicel shorter, 1.2 times longer than wide. Antennomere III elongate, 1.2 times longer than wide. Antennomere IV sub-trapezoidal, pointed anteriorly; antennomeres V – X sub-trapezoidal, rounded anteriorly; antennomere XI ovoid.

Pronotum rectangular, wider than long (ratio length to its maximum width 0.69); widest in the middle of its length, with very narrow collar on its anterior bisinuate margin, without pubescence. Posterior corners of pronotum sharp (90°). Structure regularly coarse on the whole surface consist of polygonal cells with inner wrinkles. Colour of pronotum green with two wide, black stripes in the middle.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 13–16 . 13–14 Lateral view of
Anthaxia ( Cratomerus ) tankenethi
sp. nov.
13, male holotype; 14, female paratype. 15–16 Lateral view of
A. ( C. ) gebhardti Obenberger, 1924
. 15, male; 16, female.

subSubSection.paragraph: Scutellum cordiform, dark green, with fine microsculpture.

Elytra 2.26 times as long as wide, widest in humeral angles, than regularly narrowing towards apex. Apical sixth of elytra serrate. Antero-lateral corners of elytra sharp. Humeral angles not exceeding elytra outline. Elytra narrow, not completely covering (brightly green) several abdominal tergites. Colour of elytra dark green with blackish tinge with brightly green stripe by elytral suture.

Venter ( Figs 9–10 , 13–14 ). Prosternal process widely cross-like, with sharp apices. Cuticular sculpture oval, coarse, with white short pubescence. Colour of prosternum golden-reddish, meso- and meta sternum and abdominal sternites blue with metallic lustre, with bowl-shaped structure with inner microstructure. Body venter sparsely covered with white pubescence. Anal ventrite ( Fig. 25 ) triangular, its apex sinuate, apical two thirds of lateral margins serrate.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 17–20 . 17, 19
Anthaxia ( Cratomerus ) tankenethi
sp. nov.
, male paratype. 18, 20
A. ( C. ) gebhardti Obenberger, 1924
, male. 17–18, right foreleg, anterior view; 19–20, right antenna, dorsal view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Intraspecific variability. No structural difference as well as colour differences of dorsum between sexes. Females less reddish coloured ventrally. Some specimens bluish instead of green colour.
Bionomy. Unknown, one paratype bears note „Acacia sp.“.
Etymology. Species name composed of the letters of countries of known distribution – Tan -zania, Ken -ya and Ethi -opia.
